title.narrative: Master's programme with Saint Joseph University in Beirut

description.narrative:
UNIDO already has established successful cooperation with many institutions in Lebanon including Saint Joseph University (USJ) in Beirut. The further strengthening of this cooperation has been discussed between UNIDO delegation and USJ officials in October 2018. This project proposal is a follow-up on these deliberations and aims to develop a joint Master’s Degree programme on industrial development with Saint Joseph’s University (USJ) in Beirut in cooperation with Michigan State University (MSU).
USJ runs a successful Master’s programme on Industrial Technology. The discussed new programme constitutes a parallel track including new modules provided both by MSU and UNIDO. The contribution includes the joint development of Master’s Degree Curriculum. UNIDO will provide two five-day modules delivered on-campus by experts. The content of the modules will cover inter alia the tools and methodologies that have been developed in UNIDO (on evidence-based industrial policymaking). Since USJ has centres in Sidon, Tripoli, Lebanon and Zahlé and Dubai, it could also serve the Arab region as an institution promoting ISID through education of policy makers and researchers.
